comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: Penny presents an excellent question. What is this woman holding? Perhaps Karon is right... could it be a celluloid frame purse? I'll shoot this one back to our brilliant archivists and researchers, see what we come up with! Thanks, Susannah Smithsonian Institution Archives

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: The Archives' scuttlebutt is that it may be a camera. Possibly a folding camera? According to our research associate, Marcel Chotkowski LaFollette, the Knights had a comfortable living; this might be some new model. She also mentioned his badge indicates that they were attending an annual meeting of one of the scientific societies, so this was the type of occasion for snapshots. May check in with our colleagues and experts at Smithsonian's National Museum of American History. I'll certainly follow up if new insights emerge. In the meantime, I pose the question back to you . . . what do you think?? Also, who is that lovely creature bearing such a warm and dimply grin? Susannah Smithsonian Institution Archives

comment.author: 78318579@N03
comment._content: It looks like a cigarette roling machine.  I bought one once at an antique store and took forever to figure out what it was.
